segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 36
segments.en: Linked Discourses 36

segments.pli: 2. Rahogatavagga
segments.en: 2. In Private

segments.pli: 15. Paṭhamaānandasutta
segments.en: 15. With Ānanda (1st)

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi, ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha … sat down to one side, and said to him:

segments.pli: “katamā nu kho, bhante, vedanā, katamo vedanāsamudayo, katamo vedanānirodho, katamā vedanānirodhagāminī paṭipadā?
segments.en: “Sir, what is feeling? What’s the origin of feeling? What’s the cessation of feeling? What’s the practice that leads to the cessation of feeling?

segments.pli: Ko vedanāya assādo, ko ādīnavo, kiṃ nissaraṇan”ti?
segments.en: And what is feeling’s gratification, drawback, and escape?”

segments.pli: “Tisso imā, ānanda, vedanā—
segments.en: “Ānanda, there are these three feelings:

segments.pli: sukhā vedanā, dukkhā vedanā, adukkhamasukhā vedanā—
segments.en: pleasant, painful, and neutral.

segments.pli: imā vuccanti, ānanda, vedanā.
segments.en: These are called feeling.

segments.pli: Phassasamudayā vedanāsamudayo;
segments.en: Feeling originates from contact.

segments.pli: phassanirodhā vedanānirodho.
segments.en: When contact ceases, feeling ceases.

segments.pli: Ayameva ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo vedanānirodhagāminī paṭipadā, seyyathidaṃ—
segments.en: The practice that leads to the cessation of feelings is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:

segments.pli: sammādiṭṭhi … pe … sammāsamādhi.
segments.en: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.

segments.pli: Yaṃ vedanaṃ paṭicca uppajjati sukhaṃ somanassaṃ, ayaṃ vedanāya assādo.
segments.en: The pleasure and happiness that arise from feeling: this is its gratification.

segments.pli: Yaṃ vedanā aniccā dukkhā vipariṇāmadhammā, ayaṃ vedanāya ādīnavo.
segments.en: That feeling is impermanent, suffering, and perishable: this is its drawback.

segments.pli: Yo vedanāya chandarāgavinayo chandarāgappahānaṃ, idaṃ vedanāya nissaraṇaṃ.
segments.en: Removing and giving up desire and greed for feeling: this is its escape.

segments.pli: Atha kho panānanda, mayā anupubbasaṅkhārānaṃ nirodho akkhāto.
segments.en: But I have also explained the progressive cessation of conditions.

segments.pli: Paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa vācā niruddhā hoti … pe …
segments.en: For someone who has attained the first absorption, speech has ceased. …

segments.pli: saññāvedayitanirodhaṃ samāpannassa saññā ca vedanā ca niruddhā honti.
segments.en: For someone who has attained the cessation of perception and feeling, perception and feeling have ceased.

segments.pli: Khīṇāsavassa bhikkhuno rāgo niruddho hoti, doso niruddho hoti, moho niruddho hoti.
segments.en: For a mendicant who has ended the defilements, greed, hate, and delusion have ceased.

segments.pli: Atha kho panānanda, mayā anupubbasaṅkhārānaṃ vūpasamo akkhāto.
segments.en: And I have also explained the progressive stilling of conditions.

segments.pli: Paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa vācā vūpasantā hoti … pe …
segments.en: For someone who has attained the first absorption, speech has stilled. …

segments.pli: saññāvedayitanirodhaṃ samāpannassa saññā ca vedanā ca vūpasantā honti.
segments.en: For someone who has attained the cessation of perception and feeling, perception and feeling have stilled.

segments.pli: Khīṇāsavassa bhikkhuno rāgo vūpasanto hoti, doso vūpasanto hoti, moho vūpasanto hoti.
segments.en: For a mendicant who has ended the defilements, greed, hate, and delusion have stilled.

segments.pli: Atha kho panānanda, mayā anupubbasaṅkhārānaṃ paṭippassaddhi akkhātā.
segments.en: And I have also explained the progressive tranquilizing of conditions.

segments.pli: Paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa vācā paṭippassaddhā hoti … pe …
segments.en: For someone who has attained the first absorption, speech has been tranquilized. …

segments.pli: ākāsānañcāyatanaṃ samāpannassa rūpasaññā paṭippassaddhā hoti.
segments.en: For someone who has attained the dimension of infinite space, the perception of form has been tranquilized.

segments.pli: Viññāṇañcāyatanaṃ samāpannassa ākāsānañcāyatanasaññā paṭippassaddhā hoti.
segments.en: For someone who has attained the dimension of infinite consciousness, the perception of the dimension of infinite space has been tranquilized.

segments.pli: Ākiñcaññāyatanaṃ samāpannassa viññāṇañcāyatanasaññā paṭippassaddhā hoti.
segments.en: For someone who has attained the dimension of nothingness, the perception of the dimension of infinite consciousness has been tranquilized.

segments.pli: Nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṃ samāpannassa ākiñcaññāyatanasaññā paṭippassaddhā hoti.
segments.en: For someone who has attained the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, the perception of the dimension of nothingness has been tranquilized.

segments.pli: Saññāvedayitanirodhaṃ samāpannassa saññā ca vedanā ca paṭippassaddhā honti.
segments.en: For someone who has attained the cessation of perception and feeling, perception and feeling have been tranquilized.

segments.pli: Khīṇāsavassa bhikkhuno rāgo paṭippassaddho hoti, doso paṭippassaddho hoti, moho paṭippassaddho hotī”ti.
segments.en: For a mendicant who has ended the defilements, greed, hate, and delusion have been tranquilized.”

segments.pli: Pañcamaṃ.

sections.title: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha ……

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha explains the feelings to Ānanda in terms of arising, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape.
